intro: Myosotis decumbens subsp. teresiana, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm and features small, blue to violet flowers with five petals. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit, with creeping stems that produce numerous flowering shoots. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This subspecies is well adapted to rocky and dry environments, often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
